section.title: Pustefix internals page
section.para: The Pustefix internals page provides some useful information for application developers (e.g. about configuration and status of the system, the JVM and Pustefix itself). You can additionally find some useful links triggering actions like scheduling a webapp reload or invalidating all sessions.

The page is only available at development time and can be accessed under the URL path /pfxinternals (the <pfx:editconsole/> contains an according link too). On the different tabs you can find the following information:

itemizedlist.listitem: Framework: Pustefix version and related links
Environment: Pustefix environment and system properties
JVM: JVM information and statistics, e.g. memory usage and garbage collection
System: Basic system information, like memory usage and CPU load
Targets: XSL target dependency visualization, list of available XSL templates
Search: Full text search of files within webapp, modules and classpath
Actions: List of available actions, e.g. webapp or target generator reload, session invalidation, etc.
Message: Message board showing results of last triggered actions

section.title: Special parameters for development
section.para: Pustefix supports some special parameters triggering special behaviour/functions useful during development:

tr.td: Adding this parameter to an URL the page isn't rendered, but the originating DOM tree model is displayed. Setting the value to 1 the last DOM tree plus some additional data about the application state is rendered as HTML. Setting the value to 2 the pure XML is returned (always creating a new DOM tree for the current page). Setting the value to 3 the pure XML of the last DOM tree is returned.

Adding this parameter to an URL the page is rendered using the default DOM tree as created by the default State implementation. Not using the designated State can be useful for debugging, e.g. when the page isn't reachable because of pageflow or exception issues.
